item.title: 'Significant' jump in sea lion pup deaths on South Australian island
item.description: Australia's sea lion population has had a tough winter with rising pup mortalities amid the algal bloom, but dedicated researchers are doing everything they can to help their survival as a species.

item.title: Medical and charity groups back free period product vending machines in NSW hospitals
item.description: Share the Dignity and the Australian Society of Psychological Medicine back calls for vending machines providing pads, tampons and underwear in NSW hospitals.

item.title: Mary River cod thriving in Brisbane River catchment, century after relative went extinct
item.description: An important apex predator died out 100 years ago due to overfishing and land clearing. Now, a close relative is bringing balance back to the habitat.

item.title: Man charged with murder over the death of man in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: A man will face court on Thursday following the fatal assault of a man in Cheltenham on Tuesday night.

item.title: Federal politics: Chalmers flags difficult decisions to come in next year's budget — as it happened
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers hands down the Mid-Year Economic and Fiscal Outlook showing an $8.4 billion improvement to the budget bottom line.

item.title: IPL auction sees Cameron Green become the highest-priced overseas player in history
item.description: Cameron Green earns a massive payday on the eve of the Adelaide Test, creating history in the Indian Premier League.

item.title: Lung Foundation calls for urgent action on underdiagnosis and undertreatment of COPD
item.description: Experts call for urgent action to turn around an "unacceptable" decline in testing for a disease that kills 20 people every day.

item.title: Nick Reiner to be charged with murder of parents Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner
item.description: Prosecutors will charge the son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of murder.

item.title: FIFA cuts World Cup tickets prices following global backlash
item.description: FIFA backtracks on high-priced World Cup tickets, with a limited amount of seats to be made available for less than $100.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Carey century carries Australia on day one of third Test against England at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's Alex Carey scores his maiden Ashes century to carry his team to a solid total of 8-326 on day one of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval.

item.title: Taskforce Falcon charges alleged 'onshore leader' of Alameddine crime family
item.description: The alleged "onshore leader" of Sydney's fracturing Alameddine crime family has been charged with conspiring to murder two underworld adversaries.

item.title: Celine Cremer search in Tasmanian bushland uncovers water bottle, garbage bag
item.description: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

item.title: Steve Smith ruled out of third Ashes Test in Adelaide due to nausea and dizziness
item.description: Pat Cummins says Steve Smith is a "little bit unwell" as Usman Khawaja makes a shock return to Australia's Test team.

item.title: Donald Trump orders blockade of sanctioned oil tankers leaving and entering Venezuela
item.description: US President Donald Trump's move comes a week after the United States seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

item.title: Why photos are not the most harmful thing we share about our kids online
item.description: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

item.title: Gippsland vegetable farm accused of underpaying migrant workers
item.description: The Fair Work Ombudsman has accused Bulmer Farms in Victoria's East Gippsland region of underpaying migrant workers more than $645,000.

item.title: Man who drove getaway car from fatal Canberra crash will spend at least 21 months in jail
item.description: A getaway driver who helped two teenagers flee the scene of a fatal crash near Parliament House is jailed in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: World's tallest spotted gum
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Call for North Brooman nature reserve to protect 70-metre-tall 'Big Spotty'
item.description: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

item.title: Short-term spending rises despite overall budget improvement as Treasury upgrades inflation forecast
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Finance Minister Katy Gallagher hand down their first budget update since the 2025 federal election.

item.title: Bondi attack came after huge increase in online antisemitism, early research finds
item.description: Research, which is in the early stages and yet to be peer reviewed, records a significant and worrying increase in antisemitic sentiment since October 7.

item.title: Increased police powers begin at Adelaide Oval Ashes Test following Bondi attacks
item.description: South Australian Police will be carrying rifles and exercising additional weapon and drug search powers at Adelaide Oval during the Third Ashes Test, following the Bondi terror attack on Sunday.

item.title: FBI releases footage of Brown University shooting suspect
item.description: Police say the footage shows the suspect "casing" the area around the campus before the attack.

item.title: CSIRO to receive $233 million in mid-year budget but up to 350 jobs still to be cut
item.description: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

item.title: Bondi Beach terror attack victim Rabbi Eli Schlanger farewelled at synagogue funeral
item.description: The 'Devoted Rabbi' was the first Bondi terror attack victim farewelled during a heavily guarded funeral at a Bondi synagogue.

item.title: Police officer shot in Bondi Beach terror attack named as Jack Hibbert
item.description: The second police officer injured in Sunday's terrorist attack at Bondi Beach has been identified as 22-year-old Probationary Constable Jack Hibbert.

item.title: NSW parliament recalled to discuss gun reforms after Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Premier Chris Minns said among the reforms to be discussed were proposed limits on the number of firearms a licensed shooter could own.

item.title: Falling tree kills farmer tackling blaze in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern
item.description: A 34-year-old farmer dies helping fight a fire in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern region.

item.title: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned as SA court awaits more evidence
item.description: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

item.title: Shakira Adams gets maximum time behind bars for crash that killed Matthew McLuckie
item.description: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

item.title: Rays and sharks washed up on Kangaroo Island linked to algal bloom
item.description: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

item.title: Former AFL footballer Marlion Pickett handed suspended prison term
item.description: Dual Richmond premiership player Marlion Pickett receives a suspended prison term for possessing and dealing with proceeds of crime, in what a judge calls a "line-ball decision".

item.title: Police lay murder charge against Jamesie Rankin, three years after woman's death in Katherine
item.description: Police have charged 47-year-old Jamesie Rankin with murder three years after the death of a woman who was found unconscious on a street corner in Katherine.

item.title: Bondi shooter Naveed Akram charged by NSW Police over terrorist attack
item.description: Naveed Akram has been charged over the terrorist attack that killed 15 people at Bondi Beach.

item.title: Australians are rushed and time-poor with most working unpaid hours
item.description: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

item.title: Queensland records worst flu season in a decade, with cases 18 per cent up on last year
item.description: Official data shows more than 90,000 lab-confirmed cases of influenza in 2025, which is more than an 18 per cent jump on the number of cases reported last year.

item.title: Tom McLuckie outside court after Shakira Adams is sentenced over his son Matthew's death
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Noosa Council blames 'human error' for $2.3 million AI scam
item.description: The Noosa Council is now blaming human error for a major fraud incident that cost ratepayers millions of dollars — while not acknowledging earlier supplier scam warnings.

item.title: Day-night Tests locked in for Australian summer until 2031
item.description: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.

item.title: Ashes drama for Steve Smith, Alex Carey and DRS — quick hits from day one of the third Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's first-innings topscorers get some help from England's sloppy fielders and the DRS technology on a tightly contested day in Adelaide. Here are the quick hits from day one of the third Ashes Test.

item.title: Teenager jailed after stabbing doctor at Tasmanian hospital in 2023
item.description: A doctor went through a "lengthy, risky and complicated" surgery and continues to experience nightmares and flashbacks after being stabbed by a teenager he was treating in 2023, a court is told.

item.title: Alex Carey's maiden Ashes ton rescues Australia, delights Adelaide and elevates his status
item.description: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

item.title: Cyril Mark Yeeda faces court over alleged $170k sale of alcohol in WA dry communities
item.description: Police allege Cyril Mark Yeeda sold $45,000 worth of alcohol in dry communities for $170,000.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Man refused bail charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on boat
item.description: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

item.title: Two men charged with murder after man shot in SA's wine region
item.description: Two people have been charged with murder after a 62-year-old man was shot dead near South Australia's wine region of McLaren Vale on Wednesday evening.

item.title: UK's Duke of Marlborough charged with intentional strangulation
item.description: Charles James Spencer-Churchill, 70, who is known as Jamie Blandford, is the 12th Duke of Marlborough, one of Britain's most senior aristocratic families.

item.title: Warner Bros Discovery board rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount
item.description: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

item.title: Labor faces green 'Grinch' hospital funding accusations with a budget in the red
item.description: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

item.title: How Tom Silvagni kept his name out of headlines before his rape conviction
item.description: Silvagni employed a legal team exclusively to fight for a suppression order, preventing his name from being reported by the media for more than a year.

item.title: Today in History, December 18: The lessons from Donald Trump's first impeachment trial
item.description: When Trump was elected president in 2016, he joined the world's most exclusive and revered club. But three years later, the president added his name to a smaller list of US leaders who'd been impeached.

item.title: How well do you know 2025 arts award winners?
item.description: The 2026 Oscars are just around the corner but let's give this year's arts award winners just a couple more moments in the sun.

item.title: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman used to spread false information
item.description: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman Naveed Akram in the Philippines and a fabricated Facebook page are spreading online. And an image of police officers taken out of context is debunked by ABC NEWS Verify.

item.title: The election is over, but inflation is still dominating the economic story
item.description: Jim Chalmers has started his second term as treasurer just like the first one ended: trying to frame the budget on his terms, but with one eye on inflation.

item.title: Government issues warning as mandatory registration for some NDIS providers confirmed
item.description: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

item.title: Why Trump's low-profile chief of staff Susie Wiles is making headlines
item.description: The long-time political operator is unusually candid during a series of interviews with magazine Vanity Fair.

item.title: England fume as Snicko operator admits error in Alex Carey reprieve in third Ashes Test
item.description: Snicko's boss admits an operator error dudded England out of the wicket of Alex Carey on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Bodyline bowler Harold Larwood pummeled Australia — but was pipped by pomegranates
item.description: Flying fruit pips are less menacing than the cork and leather cricket balls that Harold Larwood hurled at Australian batsmen during the infamous Bodyline series, but a showdown between the English fast bowler and a disgruntled crowd that was allegedly armed with pomegranate seeds is part of the rich story of Ashes acrimony.

item.title: Prostate cancer survivor with incontinence speaks out about lack of men's sanitary bins
item.description: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

item.title: Outback town has 'zero' rental stock as new copper mine is set to increase housing pressure
item.description: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

item.title: Victoria's gold boom continues as two big exploration tunnels approved
item.description: The Victorian government approves two companies to drill deep underground exploration tunnels amid a gold "renaissance" driven by high gold prices.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: Sussan Ley calls on Albanese to recall parliament to address antisemitism — as it happened
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley calls on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to recall parliament to address the issue of antisemitism in the community, in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Gun control debate heats up over proposed NSW firearm cap in wake of Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Firearm restrictions proposed by the New South Wales government in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack would go far to reduce the growing number of guns across the state and prevent further harm, a gun control researcher says.

item.title: Aged care centres urged to budget for live entertainment to provide human connection
item.description: A performer and an advocate for older Australians are worried that live entertainment for aged care residents is on the decline as other leisure activities, such as virtual reality, gain popularity.

item.title: Celine Cremer searchers 'take a breath', as they wait for forensic tests on phone, plastic bag and bottle
item.description: After new breakthroughs in the search for missing tourist Celine Cremer in the dense Tasmanian bush, the wait begins for the results of forensic tests on items discovered in the forest.

item.title: Oscars to stream exclusively on YouTube from 2029, academy says
item.description: In a seismic shift for one of television's marquee events, the Academy Awards will depart US broadcaster ABC and begin streaming on YouTube, beginning in 2029.

item.title: Adelaide Strikers down Sydney Sixers in BBL as Daniel Hughes makes sensational catch
item.description: The Strikers consign the Sixers to 0-2 despite Daniel Hughes taking a one-handed ripper late in the match.

item.title: Broken Hill arts community left in the lurch following funding cuts
item.description: Malyangapa Baaka Wiimpatja artist Leroy Johnson says the axing of an arts grant, which he is the last recipient of, has left the Broken Hill arts community feeling unsupported.

item.title: Leroy Johnson talks and sings about his travels through the far west.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nick Reiner appears in court charged over the stabbing murder of his parents
item.description: Nick Reiner briefly faces court three days after he was arrested over the stabbing murders of his Hollywood director father, Rob Reiner, and mother, Michele Singer Reiner.

item.title: Outback Farm stars finish first barley harvest at Central Australian farm
item.description: Amid the red dirt, termite mounds and buffel grass, the first barley harvest is finished at Central Australia's Athelle Outback Hideaway.

item.title: Crime in Victoria continues to rise, driven by an increase in thefts and family violence
item.description: The latest statistics show crime in Victoria is at its highest level since the Crime Statistics Agency started keeping records 20 years ago.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Ben Stokes cramps, DRS woes continue as Pat Cummins, Nathan Lyon claim wickets on dominant day two at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Ben Stokes has dragged his battered, cramping body to the close on day two of the third Ashes Test, with the tourists chances of victory hanging by a thread.

item.title: NT Police doubles reward for information on missing mother-of-two Angie Fuller to $500k
item.description: NT Police has doubled its reward for information related to the disappearance of Angie Fuller, almost three years after her suspected murder in outback Australia.

item.title: Woodside chief executive Meg O'Neill resigns in move to BP
item.description: The chief executive of Perth-based oil and gas producer Woodside, Meg O'Neill, resigns from the company effective immediately in order to take up the same role at BP.

item.title: Coalition 'flabbergasted' by Labor's response to calls for Bondi royal commission into antisemitism
item.description: The opposition criticises the government for brushing aside calls for a royal commission into antisemitism as pressure mounts on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to act in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

item.title: Albanese announces tougher hate speech laws in wake of Bondi terror attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to crack down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

item.title: Two years out from FIFA's equal prize goal, the men's tournament's pool will be six times that of the women's
item.description: FIFA has announced a record prize money pool for the 2026 men's World Cup, but the figures are dwarfed by the riches on offer for the biggest club competitions, and fly in the face of the deadline for parity with the women's tournament.

item.title: Netwealth strikes ASIC deal to compensate First Guardian investors
item.description: Financial services company Netwealth has agreed to pay more than $100 million to more than 1,000 clients who invested in the failed First Guardian super fund through its platform.

item.title: The best films of 2025: From gory horror to sugar-rush animation
item.description: From Australian-made gore to sugar-rush animation, here are the films that had our critics seated and watching this year.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Carey's DRS controversy leaves experts questioning use of 'Snicko' technology
item.description: The use of "Snicko" in the Ashes is questioned after yet another DRS controversy in the third Ashes Test frustrates England and helps Alex Carey to a Test century.

item.title: Local organiser calls on Albanese to attend every Bondi funeral
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores the winner as Chelsea makes it through to Women's Champions League quarterfinals
item.description: Sam Kerr heads in the winner as Chelsea secures a spot in the Women's Champions League quarterfinals.

item.title: X payments incentivised misinformation in wake of Bondi shooting, expert says
item.description: US social media platform X incentivised the spread of inflammatory misinformation in the wake of the Bondi Beach shootings, a digital media expert has said.

item.title: Bondi Beach terror attack survivor Arsen Ostrovsky recalls bullet grazing his head
item.description: Arsen Ostrovsky's bloodied selfie went viral and he is calling on social media companies to step up after doctored versions were widely spread online.

item.title: Anthony Eriksen sentenced to 26 years' jail for Lisa Fenwick's murder at south Sydney home
item.description: A man who showed no remorse after a stabbing attack on his partner in their south Sydney home is sentenced to more than 26 years in jail for the woman's murder.

item.title: Bondi Beach gunmen spent November holed up in tiny hotel room in Philippines, local staff say
item.description: Alleged terrorists Naveed and Sajid Akram spent almost a month holed up in a small hotel room in a city in the southern Philippines in the lead-up to the attack, local staff have said.

item.title: New large-scale battery approval laws in Queensland draw mixed reaction
item.description: There have been big changes in the way battery energy storage systems are assessed in Queensland. Some rural communities applaud the shift, while industry groups say it risks investment.

item.title: Humbled Albanese shifts gear as Jewish community's anger builds
item.description: This was a humbled prime minister. Showing contrition, some regret, and an acknowledgement more could have been done.

item.title: Australian National University stabber Alex Ophel 'may never be safe to be released into community'
item.description: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

item.title: Optus slapped with 21 recommendations following Triple Zero outage linked to two deaths
item.description: Kerry Schott's report into the Triple Zero outage debacle increases pressure on Optus to implement 21 recommendations, some of them "urgent", and highlights numerous errors.

item.title: South Coast WA towns brace for booming angler numbers as West Coast fishery closes
item.description: South Coast towns are calling for more funding to cope with a surge of recreational fishers as the region prepares to shut down recreational and commercial fishing.

item.title: Indigenous community mourns Stolen Generation mission site destroyed by fire
item.description: Parts of WA's Indigenous community are in mourning, while others have mixed feelings, after a former mission where members of the Stolen Generation were institutionalised was partly destroyed in a bushfire.

item.title: FBI deputy to step down from role less than 12 months after appointment
item.description: FBI deputy director Dan Bongino will step down from his post next month, ending a short but tumultuous tenure as the bureau's second-highest-ranking official.

item.title: Public officers facing corruption charges over alleged secret payments for medical devices in public hospitals
item.description: Crime and Corruption Commission (CCC) Queensland alleges five public officers accepted secret payments from sales representatives from a medical device company to place its equipment in the state's public hospitals.

item.title: 10yo Bondi terror attack victim Matilda farewelled at Sydney funeral
item.description: Mourners wore bee stickers and brought bee-shaped balloons to farewell 10-year-old Bondi victim Matilda.

item.title: Firefighters put out 'ferocious' 30m tall blaze at Forster oyster business
item.description: A NSW oyster grower is left reeling after tens of thousands of dollars' worth of equipment went up in flames just a week away from Christmas.

item.title: Safety report released into power bank fire on Virgin flight to Hobart amid rule changes
item.description: The national transport safety regulator's report into a fire, which broke out on a flight to Tasmania earlier this year, has found the blaze was caused by a lithium-ion battery experiencing "thermal runaway".

item.title: NT government's tourism permit for Lorella Springs Wilderness Park 'in excess of its powers', federal court hears
item.description: The future of an isolated tourism hotspot home to stunning waterfalls and ancient rock art is uncertain following a Federal Court hearing in Darwin.

item.title: US approves largest ever multi-billion-dollar arms package for Taiwan
item.description: The United States has approved its largest ever weapons package for Taiwan which is under increasing military pressure from China.

item.title: 'Children aren't born antisemitic': Education review aims to make Jewish students safer
item.description: The focus will turn from the threats outside the gate to those some critics say are embedded within education from a lack of Holocaust education to the harassment of Jewish students at universities.

item.title: FOGO avoids scrap heap as WA government commits to truck it away
item.description: The WA environment minister has thrown a $3 million lifeline to councils to help revive the failing 'FOGO' bin system in the South West — and says the controversial three-bin system is here to stay.

item.title: Victorian Government details 'value capture' mechanisms to fund Suburban Rail Loop east
item.description: The Victorian government turns to developer contributions and car park levies as it tries to raise more than $10 billion in funding for the first stage of the Suburban Rail Loop.

item.title: Ashes 2025: DRS madness in Adelaide Test as Jamie Smith survives, then gets out after shambolic reviews
item.description: A series of strange decisions by umpires further erodes any trust in the DRS process as day two at the Adelaide Oval devolves into "shambles" and "chaos".

item.title: Christmas Day predicted to be scorcher in Perth with top of 39 degrees predicted
item.description: With only seven more sleeps until the big day, Western Australia looks like being the hottest capital city in the nation this Christmas.

item.title: Australian Jews speak out about antisemitism after Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Jewish Australians say the terror attack at Bondi Beach has left the community feeling angry, devastated and scared.

item.title: How to handle awkward comments and conversations this Christmas
item.description: While your Instagram feed says the holidays are about joy and love, for many people Christmas is a time of managing tricky family members, inappropriate comments and probing questions.

item.title: Former Dobell MP Craig Thomson jailed over multi-million-dollar migration fraud
item.description: The former member for Dobell, Craig Thomson, has been sentenced to a maximum of four years jail over a migration scheme that netted him $2 million and for fraudulently receiving the JobKeeper payment.

item.title: Former Australian National University academic jailed for six years for raping two people in separate incidents
item.description: Chief Justice Lucy McCallum says Rick McGary has not accepted blame for the rapes, which occurred in Canberra in 2020 and 2016.

item.title: Craig Freeman bailed after being charged with 1991 murder of wife Melinda
item.description: Craig Freeman was charged last month with murder over the death of his wife Melinda in October 1991.

item.title: Lucky few Zone RV customers rejoice after receiving caravans from collapsed manufacturer
item.description: People who fully paid before the company collapsed can receive their vans if they pay an extra fee, while the majority of customers remain in limbo.

item.title: Snicko's issues, Archer argues with Stokes and catching controversy — quick hits from day two of the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer share a robust conversation, Snicko is decried as "the worst ever" and another catching controversy. Here are the quick hits from day two of the third Ashes Test.

item.title: Snicko circus distracts in Adelaide as Australia sends England sliding towards Ashes oblivion
item.description: The circus comes to town in Adelaide with technological madness marring a second day which, more importantly, saw England wilt again and Australia tighten its grip on the Ashes.

item.title: Bondi gunman Naveed Akram trained in firearm safety and hunting, Sydney shooting club president reveals
item.description: Bondi gunman Naveed Akram trained at a Sydney shooting club in "firearms safety" and "how to hunt", the club's president has revealed in an interview with a Serbian newspaper.

item.title: Tropical disease melioidosis rebranded 'melio' after record-breaking year for soil-borne bacteria
item.description: Cases of melioidosis in Cairns have set records this year, and authorities are uncertain why. But one survivor has joined a campaign to start a conversation about safety as the rains return in the north.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: PALM farm worker sentenced to eight years' jail for raping teenager near Arrawarra
item.description: Samoan national Agaalofa Agaalofa, 27, is jailed for raping a 17-year-old girl on a beach on the NSW mid north coast in 2023.

item.title: Nearly 600 trees to be lost for North Adelaide's public course redevelopment for LIV Golf event
item.description: The South Australian government has released plans for North Adelaide's public golf course redevelopment confirming that nearly 600 trees will be cut down, not the thousands previously claimed by the Liberals.

item.title: Former senior police officers detail why Bondi Beach terror incident was so difficult to defend
item.description: The investigation into how and why the Bondi terror attack unfolded has only just begun, but the question of whether there were enough police and security there that day will be central.

item.title: Queensland mother accused of staging drowning death of four-year-old son committed to stand trial
item.description: Tara Maree Richardson is charged with the 2021 murder of Tarrin O'Sullivan, with prosecutors alleging the boy was killed before being placed into the water at Munbura, south of Mackay.

item.title: Inquest hears nothing could have been done in 'rare, tragic' baby's death at Atherton Hospital
item.description: An inquest has been examining the death of a newborn at Atherton Hospital and whether the care the mother and baby received were in any way responsible.

item.title: Australian man Lamar Ahchee sentenced to 12 years in prison for role in Bali cocaine-smuggling plot
item.description: An Australian man is sentenced to 12 years in a Bali prison for his role in trafficking cocaine into the country in Lindt chocolate wrappers.

item.description: Experts say the federal government must actually use new laws being finalised this summer to crack down on hate speech and so-called "hate preachers" in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: ICAC report clears NT Police of improper conduct in arresting Zachary Rolfe over fatal shooting
item.description: A Northern Territory corruption watchdog investigation has cleared senior police officers of misconduct in their decision to arrest and charge Zachary Rolfe, following the fatal shooting of Kumanjayi Walker.

item.title: Prime minister should resign after failing to attend Bondi funerals, survivor's brother says
item.description: The brother of a survivor shot during the weekend terrorist attack in Sydney says it is "utterly shameful" the Australian prime minister has not attended funerals of the victims and has called on him to resign.

item.title: Police called to Mordialloc again after reports of assaults near pier
item.description: Police have again been called to the Melbourne bayside suburb of Mordialloc, a day after reports of a brawl involving more than 100 teenagers.

item.title: Seven men assisting police after operation at Liverpool in Sydney's south-west
item.description: Officers from the Tactical Operations Unit conducted an operation on George Street in the south-west Sydney suburb of Liverpool late on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Extra $42.6 million for mental health support after Bondi terror attack
item.description: A temporary mental health centre will be set up in Bondi offering free walk-in services to help Australians grieving and traumatised by the deadly terror attack.

item.title: French doctor jailed for poisoning 30 patients, including children
item.description: Frederic Pechier's youngest victim, a four-year-old, survived two cardiac arrests during routine tonsil surgery in 2016.

item.title: Trump Media group buys fusion power company for $9bn
item.description: The US president's company also operates a number of cryptocurrency-related financial products and owns social media platform Truth Social.

item.title: Victoria Police reviewing evidence collected under secret prison bugging program
item.description: Police will be trusted to decide whether their own conduct was illegal during a secret prison bugging program, with prosecutors saying they will only reassess cases the force flags for review.

item.title: What phone data and new discoveries reveal about Celine Cremer's movements
item.description: More than two years after Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer vanished near Philosopher Falls, new discoveries have helped investigators better understand her final movements — though many questions still remain.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: An adventurous koala, a chaotic Lionel Messi tour and a Trump blockade
item.description: Another week, another quiz. Are you ready to test yourself?

item.title: Tougher hate speech laws used four times before government vowed to rework them
item.description: Strenthened federal hate speech laws that the government held up as evidence it acted on antisemitism have been used four times since February, with it now conceding they do not go far enough.

item.title: ASIO's 'grim reality' as it picks over Bondi intelligence gaps
item.description: As Australia's intelligence agencies look back over how the Bondi attackers were missed, a "grim reality" of their jobs confronts the country.

item.title: Patients allege rape, beatings and staff cover-ups at Brisbane mental hospital in damning report
item.description: Wolston Park closed in 2001, but, for decades, it has been at the centre of disturbing allegations of abuse and chemical restraint. Now, patients' stories have been published alongside a report.

item.title: Former police officer claims he warned of Bondi terror attack a decade ago
item.description: Steve Buttel says he told his bosses "it was only a matter of time" before there would be a terror attack on Bondi's Jewish community.

item.title: Inside the classified mission to deliver Australian tanks to Ukraine
item.description: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

item.title: AHPRA puts practice conditions on neurosurgeon Greg Malham
item.description: Doctor Greg Malham, who was terminated from a Melbourne private hospital following an ABC investigation into his behaviour, will have to undertake mentoring sessions to continue practising.

item.title: Indonesian influencers glamorise life and earnings in Australia but the reality falls short
item.description: Influencers push a false promise of easy money and a better life in Australia with a Work and Holiday Visa, inspiring young Indonesians to take extreme measures to chase an almost unrealisable dream.

item.title: Achievements and regrets: Peter Malinauskas and Ashton Hurn reflect on 2025
item.description: As the political year winds up, Premier Peter Malinauskas and Liberal leader Ashton Hurn have much to contemplate over their Christmas lunch.

item.title: More photos released on eve of Jeffrey Epstein files deadline
item.description: US Democrats continue their drip-feed of material from sex predator Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, releasing more photos on the eve of a deadline for the full publication of the Epstein files.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting live updates: PM flags 'national day of mourning' for terror attack
item.description: Anthony Albanese says he will confirm a "national day of mourning" for the Bondi attack in the new year, and has declared Sunday, December 21 as a day of reflection to honour the victims. Follow live.

item.title: Anthony Albanese is forced into policy catch-up after Bondi atrocity
item.description: In an extraordinary personal censure, Australia's Jewish community effectively denied Anthony Albanese the role of being the nation's chief public mourner in this week of national tragedy.

item.title: Russell Crowe on the reappraisal of Master and Commander and its masculinity
item.description: Master and Commander flopped in 2003 but is now hailed as a masterpiece. Discover why this epic is earning renewed respect.

item.title: Thousands gather at Bondi Beach for memorial paddle-out
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The University of Philippines' dragon boat athletes are unpaid, but driven by community pride
item.description: Braving 4am starts, the dragon boat team of The University of Philippines is full of dedicated athletes. But without being recognised as an official sport, they receive no pay for their time and sacrifice.

item.title: Kenyan veterinarian David Munyua stuns the World Darts Championship in wild scenes at Alexandra Palace
item.description: Kenyan veterinarian David Munyua pulls off one of the great World Darts Championship upsets over Belgium's Mike De Decker.

item.title: How to watch Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua on Netflix, when and what time is the fight?
item.description: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua is not the first sham fight, neither will it be the last. But there is a real risk that, one way or another, it will have a lasting impact. Here's everything you need to know about the contest.

item.title: Live market updates: ANZ to pay $250m penalty, ASX rises after Wall St rally
item.description: The Federal Court has increased penalties to be paid by ANZ to $250 million, while the ASX rises after strong gains on Wall Street overnight. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

item.title: Horsham council plans bypass as thousands of trucks move through town every day
item.description: A western Victorian council says plans for a bypass might finally eventuate, as thousands of trucks travel through the city of Horsham each day amid an industrial boom.

item.title: Seven youths escape Ashley Youth Detention Centre, five back in custody, police say
item.description: Police say five of the seven youths who escaped the Ashley Youth Detention Centre last night are now back in custody. One staff member was stabbed during the breakout.

item.title: Queensland now third least-affordable state as even remote property prices rise
item.description: The Ballini family made the move to regional Queensland where they are are paying half the mortgage they were in the south-east, but that's rapidly changing.

item.title: Queensland police investigating Nazi symbol and offensive words graffitied on Brisbane mosque
item.description: Offensive words were also written on the Brisbane mosque, along with the swastika. WARNING: The following story contains an image of a Nazi symbol.

item.title: Why a $2.5 billion surplus has created a migraine for the WA government
item.description: For most other governments, a $2.5 billion surplus would be news to shout from the rooftops — but in WA's case, it's a headache with little prospect of relief.

item.title: NT Firearms Council pushes back on gun control debate after Bondi shooting
item.description: The Northern Territory Firearms Council is against limiting the number of weapons a person can own, as New South Wales parliament is set to discuss gun reforms in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Triple Zero backup system fails during four-day power outage in WA
item.description: Midwest WA residents could not reach Triple Zero amid a perfect storm of severe weather and fires, causing extended mobile and power outages.

item.title: How the world reacted to the Bondi massacre, from the Middle East to Manila
item.description: The shock waves from Sunday's deadly terror attack at Bondi Beach have reverberated around the world from the Middle East to Moscow and Manila.

item.title: Seven men arrested after operation in Sydney's Liverpool could soon be released, NSW Police say
item.description: Police now say the men may be released from custody, despite earlier claims the group held "extremist Islamic" views and may have been going to Bondi.

item.title: Prince William and Princess Catherine release 2025 Christmas card
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new family portrait to coincide with their annual Christmas card.

item.title: Former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and members of his family die in North Carolina plane crash
item.description: NASCAR icon Greg Biffle dies in a plane crash in the US, along with several family members.

item.title: Thousands of WA home owners could benefit from class action alleging delays by builder BGC
item.description: Almost two years after the slab went down, Jo and David Dimov's "forever home" is still unfinished. The couple is part of a class action that has "snowballed" against a major WA builder.

item.title: Ashes 2025 live updates: Ben Stokes bowled as England all out for 286 on day three of the third Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's batters look to build an imposing second-innings lead after Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer notch half-centuries to keep England in the game on day three in Adelaide. Follow live.

item.title: House lost near Benalla as Victoria prepares for high fire danger
item.description: One house and six sheds have been lost in a fire started by farm machinery at Goomalibee, near north-east Victorian town Benalla.

item.title: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan reveals her husband was caught drink driving
item.description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has apologised after her husband was caught drink driving, saying the incident left her "disappointed and embarrassed".

item.title: King Edward Memorial Hospital baby death review finds multiple failures in care provided to mother in labour
item.description: A review into the death of newborn baby Tommy Starkie reveals multiple failures in the care provided to his mother during her labour at Perth's King Edward Maternity Hospital earlier this year.

item.title: TikTok signs deal to sell US unit to American investors, including Oracle, Silver Lake
item.description: The deal with Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX ensures the social video platform can continue operating in the US.

item.title: UOW 'bizarre and chaotic' governance and finances under parliamentary and ICAC scrutiny
item.description: A long-serving University of Wollongong staffer tells a NSW parliamentary inquiry she reported suspected corruption to ICAC, as concerns mount over governance, financial mismanagement and executive appointments at the university.

item.title: Life on Adria Downs, one of Australia's most remote cattle stations
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Life on Adria Downs, one of Australia's most remote cattle stations
item.description: The idea of life out on the edge of the desert has pulled in young people from across the country and overseas.

item.title: Polly the pony spreads Christmas cheer in Sale aged care home
item.description: A Welsh Shetland cross pony is spreading festive cheer — and stirring memories — during visits to an aged care home in eastern Victoria.

item.title: Queensland government to continue pause on puberty blockers for new adolescent trans patients in public system
item.description: The Queensland government says it made the decision after considering a 530-page independent review into the evidence surrounding the treatments.

item.title: Broken Hill garbage truck driver collects final bins after 45 years on the job
item.description: Mark Mitchell is known for bringing the fun to rubbish collection, donning different outfits and inspiring youngsters to follow in his footsteps. But this week is his final run.

item.title: How to turn feelings of helplessness into support after the Bondi attack
item.description: While you might be feeling a sense of helplessness after the attack at Bondi Beach, there are ways to convert those feelings into small acts of support and kindness.

item.title: Prime minister announces 'largest' gun buyback scheme since Howard era
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced a national gun buyback scheme, days after a deadly terror attack on a Hanukkah celebration.

item.title: In pictures: Thousands honour Bondi victims in emotional paddle-out tribute
item.description: Thousands of locals packed the Bondi beachfront for an emotional paddle-out in honour of the victims of Sunday's terror attack.

item.title: 103-year-old Tasmanian artist and potter Eileen Brooker celebrated in book on life
item.description: Eileen Brooker first met author Sue Abdullah in the 70s, and their decades of friendship has helped build a book celebrating the 103-year-old artist and potters life.

item.title: Adelaide Railway Station joins list of declared public precincts
item.description: The Adelaide Railway Station is the latest location to be declared a public precinct, giving police extra powers to search people or order them to leave.

item.title: Seven men arrested after operation in Liverpool
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump's hand-picked board renames arts centre as Trump Kennedy Center
item.description: The venue, named after former US president John F Kennedy, is to be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center after a vote by its board — which Mr Trump himself hand-picked this year.

item.title: Canberra man caught with nearly 100 grams of cocaine is spared jail
item.description: Nicholas Kozac pleaded guilty to possessing a trafficable amount of cocaine after he was caught with nearly 100 grams of cocaine.

item.title: Australian Cricketers Association calls for Snicko overhaul following Adelaide blunder
item.description: Australian Cricketers Association boss Paul Marsh has called for an investigation into Snicko, saying careers are being affected by the technology's lack of precision.

item.title: Man charged with murder of his 88-year-old mother in Fern Bay, Newcastle
item.description: Police say Thomas Andrew Tapley was his mother's carer and it is a tragic set of circumstances for the family.

item.title: Long-running NT alcohol study recommends changes to costs and trading hours
item.description: A major study into alcohol policy in the NT has recommended tightening bottle shop trading hours, raising the minimum price of alcohol and reforming the approach to individual liquor bans in the territory.

item.title: Dimboola woman who told undercover police she gouged elderly man's eyes found not guilty of murder
item.description: Jodie Hill wept as a Supreme Court jury found her not guilty of murder and manslaughter, follow a week of deliberations.

item.title: Polly the pony
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nearly 500 small businesses seek assistance in dispute with digital platforms
item.description: The Small Business and Family Enterprise Ombudsman says he's seen a rise in small businesses disputes with digital platforms.

item.title: Police detain man in car park
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man facing 47 charges over alleged firearms, explosives, drugs offending
item.description: A licensed firearms holder has been charged with 47 offences after two NT police raids allegedly uncovered illegal explosives, unlawful weapons and illicit drugs.

item.title: Suspect in Brown University fatal shooting found dead in New Hampshire storage facility, officials say
item.description: The suspect in last week's mass shooting at Brown University has been found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound, officials say.

item.title: Dayna Isaac's murderer Paul Sultana sentenced to 44 years in prison
item.description: A judge labelled intimate partner violence "a scourge in a civilised society" when he sentenced Paul Sultana to 44 years in jail for the murder of Dayna Isaac.

item.title: Tasmania's proposed short-stay levy 'unjust', tourism industry argues
item.description: The tourism industry remains opposed to a 5 per cent levy on short-stay accommodation that the Tasmanian government has promised to implement.

item.title: The PM has announced the 'largest' gun buyback since the Port Arthur massacre. Here's what we know
item.description: Days after the Bondi terror attack, the federal government has announced a new national buyback scheme.

item.title: Rottnest plane crash ATSB probe to focus on whether seaplane had adequate safety features
item.description: The crashworthiness of a seaplane that plunged into the ocean off Rottnest island in January, killing three people on board, becomes a key focus of an investigation by Australia's transport safety watchdog.

item.title: Australian curlers Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt miss out on spot at 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australia's mixed curling team of Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt have fallen just short of qualifying for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games.
